summary: The GCC is a group of six Arab countries in the Middle East: Bahrain, Kuwait, Oman, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, and the United Arab Emirates. It was formed in 1981 to promote cooperation in politics, economics, and security. The idea was to create a stronger union, like a "Gulf Union," but not everyone agreed. These countries are all monarchies, with different types of rule. The GCC has its headquarters in Saudi Arabia and even has its own military force called the Peninsula Shield Force.
title: Gulf Cooperation Council
